course_description: This seminar introduces students to current behavioral decision research in accounting and auditing. We will begin with a few weeks of basic methodological background, as illustrated with current research papers. We will then proceed to cover research in a selection of areas of current interest. Papers are arranged by accounting topic, and we will consider key empirical results in each topic area. We will also focus on the relevant psychological theory and on the methodological advantages and challenges associated with the experimental method.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the PhD program.
